oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Paul AME, Ashland City: church directory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Paul African Methodist Episcopal Church, Ashland City
Directory of African Methodist Episcopal Churches in Tennessee.

On October 2, 1921, St. Paul African Methodist Episcopal Church was dedicated under the pastorate of E.W. Johnson. By 1968, a new church building had been erected. This building remains on Turner Street in Ashland City, Tennessee. A cornerstone, inscribed through hand-carving, attests to the humble roots of the church. At the time of fieldwork, St. Paul AME Church continued to be active and Reverend Willis Orr served as pastor.
